result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Cindy J Wadd was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to fine. Balance to be paid as a condition of probaiton.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Brookfield Police Dept. Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Sign any releases for agent.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Victim Impact Panel meeting was completed on 02/18/15.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours. Commencing Forthwith. Sentence credit of 1 day was granted.

AS OF 5/26/2016: ATC GRADUATE - Served 54 weeks in ATC. Jail portion is modified to actual time served in custody of 88 days. Any remaining jail time is vacated.

Defendant to post $1000.00 cash and sign a $5000.00 signature bond. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed and have the Ignition interlock device installed.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring. Not to discuss this case with her children.
